author: ChungusDoug
title: First Class Experience
body:
Admitted to hospital after seeing my GP at Skeith Medical Practice. Was seen in A&E, medical and nursing staff were fantastic and the care was first class. All investigations I needed were done so quickly.  
I was kept up to date with plans and treatment as was my family.  
I was transferred to Admissions Unit One and the excellent care continued. I was made to feel welcome and those who were caring for me introduced themselves to me and they made me feel at ease. Nothing was any bother to them, even for the short time I was there.  
I then went to Ward 51. The care I received was excellent. They made sure I knew what to expect and what was going to happen next. Again I was so pleased that my family was contacted and kept informed of my condition, treatment and what was to happen next.  
Overall it was a first class experience.

author: AnnieF
title: Concerns about stopping spread of covid-19
body: Concerned that staff are not taking proper steps to stop spread of covid 19. Whilst accompanying my daughter I watched numerous staff taking temperatures with the head scan thermometer without cleaning it between patients. Outside the nurses station patients were also coming and going from the easy reclining armchairs without the chairs being wiped down between patients. The water drinks machine is also positioned right next to one of the armchairs. This compromised social distancing for the patient in the chair and all those using the water machine. Also observed inconsistency between how staff were doing the covid swabs. HCA was only swabbing one nostril but the staff nurse was swabbing both nostrils.

author: Iccamatmiw
title: CMHT coatbridge
body:
I have been struggling with low mood since august. Having to juggle this and having to return to uni (had to take a year out due to plans to hang myself) and move away again I haven't been able to get consistent care. When I returned home from the year out I tried to make contact with the CMHT in the area but I got given a cpn who just spoke about wellbeing exercises which wasn't useful for me, nothing else was offered.  
Now that I'm back I was trying to get help because I didn't want to feel this way anymore. This has been since march. I understand the situation with covid but at the same time I also don't know why this is impacting help so much. The reason I'm writing this is I tried to OD yesterday, my parents who I live with walked in and I gave up the effort when they saw and phoned an ambulance, it would have been counter productive in my eyes to continue if 'help' was on the way.  
I had already taken myself to a& e a month ago because of these feelings and it's only getting worse. I got picked up by the ambulance crew, thankfully they were very understanding and said they could see I needed help. They contacted the CMHT to see me but when I went there it all went downhill.  
I don't know how long I was in a room with them, I felt they treated me like a child. I wouldn't agree to the plan of just taking more meds and just waiting, I'm past that point, I wasn't willing to give up my stash of meds because they have shown me countless times I don't matter with them and I'm done trying to fight. However since they couldn't get an agreement out of myself they went straight to my parents and said what they wanted me to agree to to them as if that was it. Then I was just sent away.  
My homelife isn't great and something that adds to the worsening of my condition. They never once asked if I feel safe there. When I got back this caused more arguments, I had to leave this home and go stay with a friend, away from my stash but not away from my thoughts and an OD isn't the only way I have planned in the past. I'm sick and tired of their lack of concern, the people that are supposed to help and it feels like they just haven't bothered. The ambulance staff said I needed help and needed away from there, and the people they took me to just turned me away because I wouldn't agree to a plan that should have been put in place 2 months ago because they haven't done enough for me.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Respect
title: Flexible Sigmoidoscopy
body:
A lovely nurse explained everything to me before and after the procedure.  
Although everyone was wearing PPE they were so attentive and caring, making an unpleasant experience bearable.

author: NHSpatient01
title: First seizure-access to neurology
body:
My father has his first seizure in January 2020. We were advised that even with the current Covid 19 restrictions he would receive an appointment (we assume for a remote assessment) within 17 weeks as his referral was marked as Urgent. We are now 22 weeks post seizure with no contact from a neurologist.  
We completely appreciate the delays etc to treatment etc within the current climate but wonder if someone would be kind enough to provide us with details as to how to get an update as to the expected timescale of his first appointment?  
As I'm sure you can understand we are keen to avoid any further seizures or hospital admissions at this time and my Father is an excellent candidate for a Near Me appointment so having an idea of timescales would really help put his and our mind at ease.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: Chrs88
title: Pain relief dependence
body:
It started with an injury at work, causing a slipped disc and unbelievable sciatic pain. I went to my Dr requesting pain relief and was started on codeine, but nothing seemed to help. I slowly worked my way up until prescribed fentanyl.  
I again was put onto a higher dose until the pain finally became manageable. Unfortunately thats really where the problems began. I began taking more than prescribed, and everything around me began to fall apart, but I was blinded by the medication. How can something that has stopped me being in pain, affect my life negatively?  
I stopped going to work, I couldn't get out of bed. I would fall asleep having a meal, I only showed the people around me affection when under the influence of the pain relief. So I stopped taking it, and subsequently experienced opiate withdrawal "cold turkey" for the first time.  
I tried everything to come off the medication without help. I thought if I told my Dr what was going on, he would cut me off and I'd be left in withdrawal. No words can truly describe the excruciating discomfort of withdrawal. You count every second, of every minute, of every hour. If your lucky enough to fall asleep, you dream about it. Its hell.  
Unfortunately I had no idea there was help available, and by the time I did, I lost my family, my partner, my friends. I honestly thought I was going to die from my addiction. Knowing this I finally told my Dr the truth. He put in touch with CGL, and that's when I found out there was help.  
I went through the groups and process. I was given buprenorphine and I that was really the hardest part over. I slowly tapered down on the bupanorphine until I was at a stage to stop. I won't lie and say the 7 days after were easy, as I still experienced withdrawal. I would say day 5 was the toughest but I got through it.  
Thats where it ends. I'm back into work, off all forms of medication and slowly rebuilding the destruction my addiction caused. The only advice I would give anyone is just be honest. If you know you have a problem, don't suffer like I did. Get help.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Amazing quick response
body: I contacted pals on behalf of my son, who is in a upsetting situation. His wife is having a baby with telepes and he has not been able to attend scans or appointments. He has felt segregated and been in an emotional state. The lady I spoke to was very understanding and kind. They contacted my son within an hour of my phone call. And then spoke to him the next day and are supporting him with access to future appointments and including him through this pregnancy. It is a difficult and emotional time for his wife and my son, dealing with covid19 and the prospect of a new born with this ailment. My son just needs to be involved and have support from the medical profession. I was very impressed by the rapid response of pals!! Enormous thanks.

author: Harryand PiP
title: my stroke
body:
I had my stroke while playing badminton. I lost my words
attended hospital and on coming home Roanne came out and looked at my cognition, also Posy spoke to me over the phone as I felt low in mood, I cant praise the staff enough, they were brilliant
The after care was fantastic and all the follow up were brilliant

title: Incredibly good and impressive
body: 4 June 2020 - just had a ? basel type carcinoma removed from chest.  Painless, sympathetic and impressive staff.  Please pass my grateful thanks to all staff involved.   So proud of NHS and the calibre of the staff.  Compliments and good wishes.  Just left to wait and hope no surprises with biopsy.

author: Toomski
title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy
body:
I was told about Ealing IAPT through my GP having been diagnosed with Depression, Anxiety and Panic Disorder.  
I referred myself and was contacted and assessed quickly by the IAPT team.  
I undertook initial CBT sessions in 2019, and I'm currently receiving Level 3 Therapy Sessions.  
Reaching out for help with my mental health and working with the IAPT's therapists has been fantastic for me. I was in a dark place, thought I was going crazy ... Now I'm becoming more self aware, I understand my tendencies better and challenge my negative thoughts. (But there's still a way to go)  
The initial therapy was a touchstone to CBT tools. The duration I felt should be longer.  
The Level 3 therapy goes deeper, is more challenging but this is what I need.  
I have found it easy to establish a good therapeutic relationship with my therapists. They have been professional, warm and understanding. I feel that they really care about my welfare and have belief in equipping with the tools to manage my conditions.

title: great practice
body: I went to pinders A and E on Monday the 1st I had a blockage in my ear was totally deaf I only work on ne ear so I was stressed I was seen by a consultant whos name I did not catch then I saw the doctor aleem laker he gave me some stronger drops that put my hearing back to normal both these guys were kind patient and really wanted to help me writing me notes so I understood them felt so supported.

title: Receptionists need customer service training
body: While I totally appreciate that we are in difficult times, there is no need for anyone to be rude. The receptionists at this practice (bar one) are always rude, abrupt, and seemingly purposely unhelpful. They give out as little information as possible and come across as if they are doing you a favour. They sound annoyed that you have called and are far from approachable. I have been given differing advice/information by different people and I am actually nervous to call. Manners and a friendly demeanour cost nothing and are surely a prerequisite for a customer facing position. What as shame as the doctors are all generally very helpful.

author: harry b
title: I have been very well looked after
body:
I have Alzheimers disease and am being looked after by Dr.Mougey and the staff at  
St.georges Mental Health.  
It was a surprise to have the diagnosis of Alzheimer's, even though I was aware my memory was getting worse.  
I would say to friends and family that I was forgetting things, and they would say--"Oh don't worry about that, it happens to all of us as we get older" (I am 80).  
I went to the G.P about another problem, and mentioned my concern.  
He said he would say 3 objects, chat for a few minutes and then ask me to recall the objects.  
When he asked me about the objects I said "What Objects??".  
He looked at the ceiling, thought for a few minutes and then sent me for a scan.  
The scan showed I had Alzheimer's and I was referred to Dr.Moughey.  
That was in September 2019.  
Since then I have been very well looked after by Dr.Moughey--she has a good sense of humour, answers all my questions (and there are many), gives me very good advice re my medication and is available if I wish to discuss something with her.  
I am coping well with my condition. The main concern is not being able to remember a word or name in the middle of a conversation. This causes me to talk less in case that situation occurs.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: Great Caring Practice
body: I have been a patient at this practice for over 45 years and have always been very impressed with the swift caring treatment that I have received whatever the illness. Even friends have been impressed with the speed that I have had hospital appointments. The open surgeries on Monday and Friday mornings are something that I hope never changes. Even during the current Covid pandemic I have been very impressed with the speed of appointments and being called in to the surgery for a consultation

title: WHAT CARE ?
body:
Was brought in to A@E at the RVI ,I was then transferred to ward 16 Freeman hospital. I was very poorly and was told i needed to be in hospital on IV antibiotics and pain meds .
First of all I wish I had never been sent to this ward. Rude is an under statement a lot  of the nursing staff are ignorant rude and not very caring .This is very sad . 
The cleanliness of the ward is absolutely diabolical, I brought it to the attention of the  nursing staff that the toilet and bathroom had now not been cleaned for 3 DAYS. I was wrong for asking if there was a clean toilet anywhere else I could use. 
I thought we were in a Pandemic? in these times when we have all be told that cleanliness is the upmost importance to stop the spread of anymore infections and diseases.

I have seen how busy the ward gets and I have also seen the ward  not busy . When you make myself and others  wait anywhere up to an hour for pain or other medication and not just on one occasion on several this is not acceptable, so when the patient gets upset because you are been rude . Step back take a hard look at what yous are doing its cruel and not acceptable .
I would never ever be happy to come back to WARD16 FREEMAN ever.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing service
body: I came down very ill and got to the point I had to ring 111 who sent out an ambulance for me who were very quick helped me alot. Took me to the hospital. When I arrived the nurses were phenomenal and were with me all the time. I stayed over night and the care I recieved was great

author: Mrsslow
title: Covid 19 Screening  prior to clinic appointment
body: I had been made aware of the Screening that would happen.   As I approached the place, I was met by a friendly nurse who introduced herself and led me through the process.   No personal details were requested only health question.   It was quick and pleasant.   Only problem I had was that I walked past it unaware of  where it was.

title: Outstanding
body: I was called within about 30 mins of completing the 111 covid form online by a Dr. I have unfortunately had a lot of interaction with healthcare staff over the last couple of wks. The person I spoke to today was absolutely outstanding. Clear, kind, thorough- reassuring through explanations. I wish they could know what a difference they made. Thank you to all of you.

title: Recovery
body:
Hi 
I left a review in February 2019 when I left Chapman Barker,I am still alcohol free and my life is much better, I have resurrected my career, the couple of weeks I was with you at chapman Barker have helped me move forward,I attend various AA meetings which is also a great help,one of my mentors has said to me,that if you do not pick up a drink,you cannot get drunk,and that has stuck with me,I hope this gives the people in CBU a boost,it has been hard,but you have to be strong,Good luck to you all.

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb care and treatment
body: I received speedy, exceptional care despite the trying times we are all experiencing. The Advanced Nurse Practitioner returned my phonecall within the hour and arranged to see me half an hour later! His prompt help and excellent treatment, for a sudden painful problem, was very much appreciated.

title: Mental Healthcare
body:
I was so fortunate  to be offered this service as it is the only mental health support attached to a GP.  The support I received from my mental health nurse was second to none and I know I can contact her should I need to any time in the future.  
I feel this type of support should be offered in all GP practices as good mental health is very important in these very stressful times.

title: friendly efficient
body: They are all in my experience kind, efficient and understanding. This has even improved recently with the arrival of a new consultant.

title: This doctor and his team restored my hope in this…
body: My daughter who is 2 years old and surgery twice by the same doctor , bearing in mind she is a strong willed young lady, he was lovely couldn’t ask for someone better the ent department where more then amazing helped me with everything , made sure I was ok as well as my little one. To be honest if it wasn’t for this doctor i don’t think I would have coped , can’t thank them enough .AMAZING human beings

author: First time mum
title: Accessing patient out of hours for a child during lockdown
body:
My 1yr old son took very poorly developing a high temperature late in the evening, I called 111 worried I would have a long wait but the call was answered promptly and the call handler friendly. This was escalated to a Gp phone call followed by a face to face out of hours Gp appointment.  
As an NHS employee I was aware of the restraints in services due to covid 19 and concerned as a parent about my child’s deteriorating health. All staff were helpful, understanding and professional. Every aspect has handled efficiently and safely. My son was extremely well examined and cared for. He has responded to the antibiotics supplied. Thank you to all the staff that night and thank you nhs!  
Ps as precaution due to his Temperature I had covid test arranged online for the same day and negative result revived the following day meaning I could return to work. We are very lucky In scotland.

title: Worthwhile
body: I attended six three-hour sessions via video link due to the lock down and covid-19 outbreak. I found the course to be an enlightening experience. I learnt a lot, how the pain is transmitted, nutrition (what make the pain worse or better) mindfulness (how that can help reduce the pain) and pacing. The group consisted of a mix of ages and sexes. The sessions were held with good humour, while at the same time teaching us ways to manage the pain. I would encourage anyone suffering with chronic pain to attend and try to get the benefits I have gained.

title: Fantastic experience
body:
My son was transferred to Salford Royal for emergency spinal surgery in early February. We had just celebrated his 18 birthday and this illness came out of the blue. He was extremely fit and active prior to this. 
After experiencing unusual symptoms he was eventually diagnosed in Macclesfield as suffering from a spinal abscess and had lost some sensation below the waist on admission. They sought advice from specialists at Salford Royal who advised immediate transfer. From the minute we landed at Salford Royal both the staff and treatment were excellent. 
This was an extremely challenging and stressful time for the family with a positive outcome far from guaranteed. The consultant surgeon met us soon after arrival. He was open, honest and explained everything. He offered no false guarantees, which was difficult to hear at the time but appreciated. They acted fast and arranged surgery within a few hours despite complications with blood clotting, a complication of the infection that had to be rectified prior to surgery. 
After surgery he was transferred to ward H5 where we found the staff friendly, supportive and helpful. When I left each evening I was reassured he was in safe hands. Communication was excellent throughout. I am so grateful to all from the medical staff and physios through to the domestics who kept his room spotless and staff who worked hard to keep him well fed during his recovery.
We felt well supported throughout, and following discharge we returned for a routine dressing change; one of the doctors sought us out to enquire about how my son was doing post discharge. 
The aftercare has been amazing and we have received all follow up input as we were advised. 
My son has recovered so well his functioning is almost back to normal after a few months, an outcome that could only be dreamed of at the point of admission. 
Can’t fault the care received in any way. First class!! Keep up the good work Salford Royal.
From an extremely grateful Mum

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

title: Excellent practice
body: The appointment was on time, carried out in a safe, efficient and friendly manner. I felt reassured, safe and cared for.

title: Thank you
body:
I have had in the past had my moans and groans about Hall Green Health. I must now say during these difficult times with the Coronavirus in the fore front , for me Hall Green Health have always been most helpful , polite and have not rushed me off whenever I’ve phoned . Today for example the receptionist I spoke to , took the time to see if my usual doctor would be available to have a telephone consultation with me . I felt much more relaxed knowing I would be speaking to someone who knows me and I them .
A big thank you to you all for your care , consideration and happy disposition

title: Excellent Service provided.
body:
Telephoned Monday morning approx 9am regarding a medical concern. Doctor called me back within 30 minutes. I was given a diagnosis by the doctor as a result of the telephone consultation. The doctor arranged for prescriptions to be issued that day and advised me to make an appointment for a blood test with the surgery. I duly arranged the blood test for 1125 that morning at the surgery and then collected my prescriptions form the chemist at1215. 
This was very impressive service from the Doctor and staff at the County Surgery. Within 3 and a quarter hours of making first contact I had received a consultation, blood test and prescription. Impressive.
Following on from this I saw the Doctor three days later for a confirmation that his original diagnosis was correct as advised by the blood test. Again very impressive.
During the visits to the Surgery for the blood test and Doctors follow up appointment I felt thoroughly safe due to the thorough Coronavirus safety procedures in place.

title: Great help
body:
Staff great medical nursing and admin.

Potoring   needs training . Getting 5 into small lift and chair. It seems about who gets priority.  Staff subcracting staff would not give patient prioiryso squeezed all into potential contaminated lift . Patient had to refuse and get out of chair and lift. 
Senior staff nurse to have a chat with Porto ring. Shame as this show pandemicgetinto clinical area

title: Great attentive service
body: I am very happy with the services I've received from the GPs. I've found them to be very professional and compassionate. They truly listened to me and made me feel heard.

title: Great Care
body:
Have been attending the surgery for a few years now. Have always had brilliant care. 
Especially when I was pregnant, midwife service there is fantastic and I was so happy my whole pregnancy with them.
After care for our check ups has been top notch. They take concerns very seriously and have always offered advise, further testing, blood works, physical exams and ultrasounds. 
Immunisation for my son have always gone well and it has been the same nurse each time whom has always been lovely and caring and talked us through dozens of questions and treated our son so well.
Emailed late last night with a concern and they called me back this morning before I attended a video call with them where they gave me great advise and have settled my mind and I didnt have to risk going to the surgery during the current pandemic. 
Highly recommend this surgery, it can be hard sometimes to get an appointment but I've found this at every surgery I've been with, they have always tried their best to be as accommodating as possible.

title: So grateful
body: I just wanted to say a huge thank you to all concerned for the support I received yesterday.  I was frantic with fear but your swift attention made all the difference.  I cannot thank you enough

title: Rude telephone assessment
body: I couldn't get through the assessment, the call operator was curt, asked me personal questions in an abrupt manner, then told me I sounded irritated when I hadn't even said anything. She then told me I couldn't have two treatments at the same time when I said I was having therapy from Supporting Minds. I wouldn't recommend this service in any way.

title: Excellent practice
body:
Outstanding doctors. Personalised, sympathetic care. Doctors listen to concerns and worries, take time to clearly clearly illness, treatments and give helpful advice on getting back to health. 
Doctors here understand the importance of communication, sympathy and encouragement someone with ill health may need.
The reception staff are organised, polite and very helpful.

title: Phlebotomy queuing
body: I am diagnosed with a terminal cancer and awaiting a transplant. I arrived for a  blood test at 7.40 am, aware that it is a busy time but assuming it would be cleaner not having had patients there overnight. The department opens at 8, and there was a queue. I handed my papers and asked if I could wait in my car until 8 as I was shielding and was very afraid to be out. The receptionist agreed. At 8 I went back and explained I had been waiting outside. By now all the people who had been waiting before me had been replaced by another queue. I waited, and when two people who had come in after me were called I asked if I would have to wait much longer as by now I’d been a total of 40 minutes and was shielding, the reply was a terse “A lot of people are shielding, it won’t be long”. I explained again that I’d given her my form at 7.40 and had asked if it would be ok to wait outside and she replied that she hadn’t seen me. I appreciate people are busy, and it wasn’t a huge  wait, but I got home and broke down because I was so afraid. The receptionist wasn’t practicing social distancing, standing right next to people in the corridor collecting forms, she didn’t wear a mask or gloves and spoke very abruptly to an elderly gentleman who was taking a while to stand up to move along in the queue. I don’t know what has happened to the concern for mental health but I am left feeling incredibly vulnerable. I do not usually go to QE2 but I’d gone to Hertford the previous day and it was closed, and I couldn’t get a home visit in time and so I had no choice. A little thought and a kind word would have made a lot of difference.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Amazing service
body:
Brought my mum today for tests at ACU. The staff are welcoming, reassuring, professional and very thorough.
We were made to feel cared for and they all went out of their way to be friendly. Thank you

title: Helpful
body:
Today I phoned to make another phone call appointment with the doctor. The receptionist informed me of a new service for eye conditions. I phoned one of the nominated opticians and was able to get an explanation of the condition and a recommendation for further treatment. This was a lot quicker that waiting for the busy doctors to get back to me.
Thank you to he receptionist for the suggestion.

title: Online system confusing and useless
body: My 89 year old mother called the practice for a consultation, because she was feeling acutely unwell. She was told she should use an online form, which she was not able to do. I then spent half an hour on the phone with her going through the online form, completing detailed information on her symptoms, problem and what help she was seeking. After 30 minutes of form filling, we got to a page that said "you need urgent medical help. please call your gp surgery" furthermore, it said that none of the information completed would be kept or passed on to the surgery! What was the point, and why didn't they offer her an appointment when she first called, instead of making her (and me) go through this useless exercise! If you do make people fill in the form, then at least keep it and ask the GP to look at it to save some time when they call for the appointment. I am very disappointed and frustrated with this system.

title: CANNOT get through..
body: I can never get through to anyone on the eye clinic dept or retinal secretary via call. Even to find out about my apt update know one knows. No one calls back. How am I left feeling? Whats my update? What is happening with my treatment? No reassurance, no letters via post regarding my next apt, I have to call and chase and turn the world upside down to find out whats happening. I understand theres a pandemic going on but surely a call atleast?

title: nightmare to speak to a human
body: I phoned as my daughter has had problems breathing as her prescription has taken more than 2 weeks left with the  gp from pharmacy 2u.  I phoned gp surgery first and spent 2 minutes listening to a covid voice message then another 2 minutes listening to the normal gp message then had to press numbers then when i got through to the prescription query line they said i needed to phone another number.  phoned that number another 4 minutes listening to what they are happy to deal with for prescriptions which i'm sure they could have told me face to face and what they wouldn 't.  Which as a consequence left me 1 minute until the line closed for lunch.  At which time when it was answered the person just kept fobbing me off saying if we'd have received the prescription it would have been dealt with.  But i know full well it's been sat there for 2 weeks.  had to talk over the person a few times and eventually they said hey would get it sent out today.  phew what a nightmare just so  my daughter can breathe.

author: Kasha
title: A lifetime of depression cannot be helped in eight hours
body:
I was referred for psychodynamic therapy. I saw a therapist once a week for one hour. We discussed my issues and looked into what might be causing them. I opened up long buried feelings. Admitted things I have never admitted before. Just as I started to feel I might understand the route of my problems the course ended.  
I was left to face the world more exposed and vulnerable than ever. I rang to say I wasn’t coping. Despite them saying I could always refer myself for further help I was told it hadn’t been long enough since my last session. I feel helpless. Yes I can see my GP. Who can prescribe tablets or refer me to someone with a waiting list. I know the tablets don’t work, I’ve already been down that route. I don’t have the strength to start again with a different therapist. Surely these mental health experts know the torture they put you through remember things and feelings you’d rather forget. Why do they think starting again with a different therapist is in anyway a reasonable solution.  
If I could change the past, then when they offered me eight hours help, I wouldn’t take it. A lifetime of depression cannot be helped in eight hours. I’m so sad the therapy stopped I learned so much just not enough. It’s like someone sent me an inflatable life raft and then burst it as soon as I climbed in.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Sashcool007
title: Time to walk the walk
body:
Alcohol dependency, finally after 50 odd years of using, leading in to Recovery.  
Just turned 60 and there seems to be a great urgency in my work (Recovery). Now the end. Time to walk the walk and talk the talk.  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
[Very unhappy with 'Team work']  
[Very happy with 'Transport']

author: ospreyxx95
title: Excision of lesion on right nasal bridge.
body:
Doctor's referral to private hospital Exeter Medical Ltd for excision of lesion on right nasal bridge.  
In February 2020, I was referred to Exeter Medical Ltd by my GP for the diagnosis and treatment of a lesion to the right bridge of my nose. My GP practice (Haldon House Surgery, Exmouth) not only referred me quickly and promptly, but the treatment I received from Exeter Medical Ltd was outstanding; the staff were friendly, supportive and helpful. The treatment given to me was thorough and patient-centred. Furthermore, my treatment was also completed before my initial appointment was due to commence. Parking was free and readily available. The environment was very clean and tidy. Reception was friendly and helpful. The appointment was honoured and completed on schedule. My results and follow-up information was also prompt and provided on time. The removal of my stitches was also completed by my GP nurse practitioner within the given time frame and done with the greatest care.  
Many thanks again to Haldon House Surgery, Exmouth and to Exeter Medical (part of Ramsay Health Care).  
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Very happy with 'Transport']

title: Brillant practice
body:
I have recieved excellent care recently for some of the GPs and mental health nurse and also nurses
 at the practice with the illness I have /still going through ....they have helped me loads when I needed it .

title: Absolutely brilliant Rheumatology Dept
body:
I have been attending Rheumatology here for the past 20 years and have never had a bad experience.  Staff are always so helpful - sometimes you may need to wait a bit longer but that's because the staff spend extra time with the patients if its needed- they are all so kind.   Even the receptionists are lovely - despite having  to put up with extremely rude demanding patients quiet often :(
Patients often forget they arent the only one who is ill and demand to be seen before other patients!!
I have been to numerous departments here and have always been well treated by very pleasant staff.   Even as an in patient.   Be nice to staff and they will be nice back - I have heard so many rude patients being horrible to the staff and it costs nothing to have manners.

readBy.name: North Middlesex University Hospital NHS Trust

title: Rude receptionists.
body: Spoke to receptionist on my husband's behalf.Every time I have dealings with this receptionist she is rude and patronising.Having worked in the health service for thirty years myself I am appalled at her attitude.Further training in customer service and monitoring would make for a better experience for patients trying to get help.She has no empathy at all.I have also ,as per a previous review, been in reception when the phones have been ringing and ringing and staff ignoring them and chatting away.The G.P.s are great but admin. staff on the whole very disappointing.

author: Grateful from Poole
title: End of Life Hospice care
body:
My mother was admitted and died in our local hospice in mid December 2019.  
The nursing and medical care was fantastic and my mother felt relaxed and commented how lucky she was to be cared for in the hospice.  
During her last few days of life the staff kept my mother as the focus of their care and attention while at the same time were aware of the needs of the family and kept us all well informed (as allowed by my mother!)  
On admission to the hospice the Dr carefully explored my mothers understanding of the situation and any fears or worries that she had. The Dr was honest in her responses without being harsh or too blunt, this approach, while upsetting was also reassuring.  
The nursing staff were attentive and caring and responded quickly to control any symptoms.  
Overall the only similarity I can give was it was like being in your favourite restaurant - the staff were attentive, aware of the needs of all involved and increased their involvement when required but also kept in the background when they were not required.  
The only minor negative comment I would make is regarding a voluntary group who care and gave out a "goody bag" to the patients. The bag contained shower gel, shampoo and a comb (among other things). This was not entirely appropriate as most of the patients were confined to bed and a lot had been treated for cancer and they did not have a lot of hair. My mother saw the funny side of this but it could have been upsetting for some. My suggestion would therefore to ensure gifts being given out, even from voluntary groups at Christmas / Easter, should be checked to ensure they are appropriate.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great Practice
body: I contacted the Surgery as was experiencing hip & back pain. Due to Covid crisis, the Doctor contacted me with thin an hour, gave me a prescription and referred me for a Video call to the Physio. This call was received the next day, was efficient and good natured. He sent me some exercises and also a video to help with the management of my pain. I’ve been a patient for 57 years so feel like family! 💞

author: The Hermit
title: 2 hospital stays in 4 weeks!
body:
I've spent the 4 weeks from May to June on 2 different wards at Newcastle-upon-Tyne Royal Victoria Infirmary.  
Taken in with severe abdominal pain - diagnosed as a Perforated Diverticulitis. Cared for brilliantly on Ward 46. Discharged after two weeks.  
The next day I had to ring 999 due to excruciating hip pain. Had to crawl from my bed to front door to let paramedics in. Given Morphine injection and taken straight to the hospital. Diagnosed with severe Osteoarthritis Flare-Up - pain was 15+ on 0-10 scale. Excellent treatment in admissions suite and then on Ward 42. Staff on 42 were wonderful.  
The only problem was with my discharge from W42 on 2nd. I was just told "Your transport is here and here is your medication." No instructions on how to take my new medications - especially as I am now on Morphine Sulphate tablets and liquid Oramorph. I was also supposed to be seen by Pain Management Team whilst in hospital but I wasn't.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Badglands
title: Still waiting over 1.5 yrs for follow-up
body:
Still waiting over 1.5 yrs for follow-up after initial appointment with Endocrinologist.  
Saw Dr. Franke in November 2018 regarding parathyroid insufficiency/hypocalcaemia following surgery to remove a parathyroid tumour in 2012.  
Still waiting for a 'follow-up'appointment 1 year and six months after initial appointment.  
Rotherham General's Endocrinology is a busy one, awash with Type II Diabetic patients; to such an extent that other endocrinology patients tend to be put to the bottom of the pile. However, I think that waiting 1.5 yrs is somewhat excessive. Perhaps I've been lost in the system?

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: SisterLove
title: Looking after my sister with Dementia
body:
After nearly 3 years my sister was finally diagnosed with some form of Early Onset Dementia at the beginning of this year by the Neurology Consultant at QMC. We were referred to the Working Age Dementia Team and were awaiting tests to make a final diagnosis of the type of dementia my sister has. Then the Virus hit.
The Working Age Dementia team have been in regular contact with us to offer support and advice. My contact Sharon has been an absolute star, She has listened to me cry and talking things through with me. Giving me ideas on how to help my sister
We both hope to meet up with her one day and finally get Lisa's tests once all this Corona madness has passed.
Thank you Sharon

title: The worst hospital in all aspects
body: Hi, I'm from Europe, young guy lucky still alive, in Covid 19 period stuck in UK, and suddenly had a problems with heart(chest pain) and I'm absolutely scary what bad health care system is in UK, what a unskilled peoples are working in Hillingdon hospital. I came to hospital in very bad condition with neighbours help, because hospital did not want to send an ambulance( when I came 3 ambulance was empty) I came to hospital with 147 blood pressure(normal is 120) also I had wait in que an around 4hours, so long story short they give me a pain killers, paracetamol and said that I can go home and this is absolutely shocked me. Thank god I'm on the way to my country still in bad shape, but one thing I know, that expierence with UK health care was stuck in my head until the end of my life. I will never recommend to any kind of people trust with NHS garbage system and if you wanna be alive just go to other places or private clinics.

title: Appreciation
body: Just wanted to share my appreciation to the lady that took my bloods today. I don't know her name but she is definitely in the right job and made me feels so much at ease. I have a phobia of needles and was able to sit up for the first time having them done! That's a milestone for me. Also a thank you to the Doctor that I spoke to on Wednesday and to the reception staff. Keep doing the amazing jobs you do.

author: adamsfamily
title: About my visit to hospital
body:
As I suffer with anxiety I was not allowed to have some one with me as I sit there for a hour and half it made me very unsettled which calls panicky attacks.  
I got to see a nurse, all she did is ask how I did it and what meds I was on and go back in waiting room for the doctor never took temp or anything else. As I was waiting to be seen a woman came in saying she had a test done in may and the test said it was positive and had to wait to see where she had to go - don't you think it could have passed on to others which was sat in the waiting room?  
When I see the doctor he took me in the room and ask what I had done and pressed on it said something about my bone (I could not really hear with the mask on) and to go and take pain killers, even though my hand was swollen and my wrist. I have no faith in Lincoln county hospital.

title: Excellent practice
body: I consider myself extremely fortunate to have registered at such an exceptional practice. The staff are professional, welcoming, and always helpful. They have continued in this supportive and reassuring manner during the COVID crisis. They have ensured that I have received my repeat prescription each month - while I have been locked down away from home. Many thanks to all of the staff, your work is much appreciated.

title: Eye Outpatients and Day Surgery
body:
I continue to visit Eye Outpatients for treatment for glaucoma and I have now had operations on both eyes as a day surgery patient since February.

I feel so fortunate to have benefited from the dedication and commitment of the consultant and his team of registrars.  I also can not speak highly enough of the other staff in the department from the helpful and efficient Reception staff to the nurses, care assistants, visual fields technicians and the lady who cleans throughout the department and who seems to be on duty ever time I attend for an appointment.  The same is true of the staff on C25 who were on duty when I attended my last surgical appointment.  They are all magnificent people under normal circumstances but the effort that they are currently making to keep the service running during the COVID outbreak is astonishing.

title: Accommodating
body:
I have been a patient at Kingswood Surgery for over 10 years, and my husband changed surgeries just before we married (nearly 4 years ago). We have recently moved house and were aware that our new home was out of catchment, and would therefore need to change practices. This was not something either of us wanted to do but understood why it had to be done. Unfortunately due to the current pandemic, we were not able to change surgeries immediately. Luckily Kingswood allowed us to stay registered with themselves during this time. We wrote a letter to update our address and later the same day, received a call from the practice manager saying that it wouldn't be necessary for us to change doctors. 
Now this may only seem like a small thing to some people but for my husband and me, it is massive! Between the 2 of us, we have numerous life-long health conditions with 7 monthly repeat prescriptions. The thought of going through everything again with a new doctor was incredibly daunting. Being with the same surgery for such a long time meant that we not only had good relationships with the doctors and nurses, but the front desk staff too. We have always felt respected by the staff and been more than happy with the level of care we have received. Something that neither of us take for granted.
As I said before, this may only seem like a small and insignificant gesture to some people, but not for us. It is a huge weight that has been lifted and a worry we no longer have to deal with.
Thank you for not just seeing us a "name and address" on a piece of paper but rather as individuals. For this, we are extremely grateful.

author: Mummy25
title: Maternity services
body:
I received fantastic care for all the staff in dr greys through out my pregnancy. Especially my midwife Anne Marie who was fantastic so nice having the same midwife from start to finish ,also kirstie who I saw a few times.  
Ended up in Aberdeen to give birth due to being overdue,all the staff were fantastic in Aberdeen aswell.

author: Grace20
title: Recurrent loss
body:
I recently had my 3rd miscarriage. It was my third loss in a year.  
Whilst waiting to have the third loss confirmed I had numerous scans. During one internal scan, the sonographer took a personal call on their mobile from their partner. The internal device was still in me throughout this call.  
During another scan there were 2 sonographers in the room. They didn’t talk to me. They spoke amongst themselves about a dispute one of them had with a neighbour. During both these scans the purpose was to look for a viable pregnancy, my child, I was ignored throughout.  
I lost my last pregnancy in February. I was told to keep the foetal tissue and send it off for testing. I did this at the end of February and was told the results would take 8 weeks. I eventually chased these in May and was told my results came back at the end of February but no-one had told me.  
I finally had blood tests yesterday to check for clotting issues, lupus etc. I was told the majority of my results would be back today. When I phoned to chase I was told this isn’t the case.  
I wanted to raise these issues so other women don’t have to go through what I have. Each time through these unprofessional scans I’ve had to sit in the EPU surrounded by happy couples. The fact that ladies losing babies have to sit next to happy pregnant ladies is very unfair.  
I must say that I have always had compassion and care from Ceri who is a midwife in EPU and from Sarah who is the Berevement midwife. However the sonographers I saw in February acted unprofessional and cold and made an awful situation 100 times worse

author: Lhdanesh
title: Our dad's last days
body: Our father had a massive stroke and we all were confused, upset and extremely sad. Then they said they moved him to AMU in centenary section of Lancaster hospital. We went there, no one was in hurry, everyone was the kindest people we had ever seen, from the lady who was asking for drinks to doctors and nurses. We all felt it was a piece of heaven with angels around. We all can not thank them enough. They are the real heros and my daughter is expired to join the team in helping people. Thank you NHS and thank you Acute Medical Unit staff we all love you so much

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: jessamine
title: my mum and her care or lack of care
body:
Found my mum on the floor at her home where she had been all night ,given the fact she had severe bruising to her head down her neck and swelling and severe bruising across the base of her back and slightly confused ,I called an ambulance who assessed her ,taking her to the toilet which she could hardly walk .  
Up to this time mum had lived independently with no mobility issues . The ambulance crew took notice of bruising and swelling and decided to take her to bgh. I stayed behind to collect medication and essentials, then rushing to hospital.  
Mum sat in casualty for near 4 hours. noting my mum was becoming more unwell I felt I had to bring up my concerns with staff. Mum at no time had a collar fitted .eventually mum was taken for scans to find she had a broken neck, broken pelvis and bleed to her brain and this was a 78 year old woman who had sat for hours in a wheelchair for hours without any care. That had included fluids all day.  
From then on my mums stay in the bgh was a nightmare to be honest if I was to tell the story of her total care I would need to go on forever. I myself don't keep good health and have nightmares about having to have any time in that hospital but I feel myself there could be other reasons why at times I have been treated badly at the bgh.  
I would like to meet with someone from the complaints department to discuss everything, mum passed away so I am dealing with that at the moment. And given the covid 19 I am shielded until mid july. and im sure the hospital has lots of work at this time but when the time is right I would appreciate some time to go through the complete disaster we as a family suffered

author: Floyd one
title: My recovery
body: This pandemic has actually been good for me, well the isolation has anyway, I don't mind my own company cos I've got a lot of issues with other clients about things which have happened over my 32 years of chaos so being at CGL is definitely not the right place for me to be at the moment, maybe when I am further into recovery things may look different to me, but just for now I'm going to be really selfish and just focus on my own recovery because I'm only twelve months clean and still finding myself

title: Give up
body: Went here with brain damage had tests all come  back normal so instead wanted to refer me to mental health team still here 2 years with brain damage and chlosteatoma of the ear now what I had an op for in 2007 at a different  hospital  and no one can tell me whats wrong when all the evidence is there put a complaint in but u don't even hear bk from that just another number to them  paid private twice still no answer better off just dying in agony then even bother going hospital  u don't get anywhere just been on a merry go round for 2 and half years passed from department  to department then to mental team u couldn't make this up could u

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: DF17
title: Video consultation
body: I had my first, video consultation, this morning. My experience was very positive. Being able to stay at home, saved me time, and it was nice, being able to sit in the comfort of my own home, and still have face to face communication, with the clinician. Although no tests could be done, a full history was taken, along with my future care Planned.

title: Excellent service
body: On arrival my temperature was taken. Harold Wood centre was clean. My appointment was on time. I am really happy with the care I received.

author: benwiemy
title: They have all been superb
body:
I had an ischemic stroke in Dec 2019 at 46 years of age, went to QMC, transferred to City Hospital. The Community Stroke Team called me the day I was discharged, Christmas Eve! I can't say enough positive things to describe the excellent care and work they do. They have all been superb, providing me with everything I needed, assessing the types of care I didn't need so as to not overwhelm me. The staff are knowledgeable and proactive in everything they do, never is anything too much trouble.
From the get-go they understood me, my situation and the type of person I was and used it my benefit. They are all absolutely professional and caring and I'd like to thank them all.

author: Happytobehere
title: Painless lesion removal
body: I had small lesion on my lip and was waiting to have it removed since March. I was contacted by phone to go to Stirling Community Hospital in May. I was a bit apprehensive but I couldn’t have been made to feel more safe. My procedure was done by David & Kirsty assisted but I didn’t feel a thing. They spoke to me and reassured me the whole time. I am so grateful that people like them are willing to risk their own health to help people like me.

title: Great practice
body: they spoke nicely, they gave me the best advice and medicines for the childthe staff is very good, good organizing conditions, I am very satisfied with them

title: Truly wonderful Community Surgery!
body: I've been registered with this Practice for nearly 10 years now and can honestly say they are the most wonderful group of Health professionals I have ever met. There is a brilliant Team Spirit. From Receptionist to Doctor, Nurse to Manageress, everyone is friendly, caring, compassionate and always willing to go the extra mile. I feel blessed to have come to know and admire everyone so well, it feels like I have made some really good Friends, that's the way these kind Souls treat me. Clinical expertise and advice is second to none. If you are either new to the area,or looking to change Practice, I cannot recommend this one highly enough!

title: video video consultation
body: It was a video call unfortunately initially it said I had to down load the app the instructions weren’t clear but did manage to get it to work  more info on letter re getting text message first and then logging  before hand  In the letter re the call would have been helpful i do use IT But lots of people my age and older don’t this would have saved the consultant time and my time as my appointment  was approx 40 mins over due  And I was fitting my appointment into my working day

title: Poor service
body:
We have had a number of bad experiences with this GP surgery.  The reception staff are very rude and abrupt, we are put on hold for long periods of time when requesting information or for appointments.  The primary doctor is rude and seems to be running a business as opposed to helping patients out. 

The practice manager is very rude and abrupt when communicating with patients, he has no filter or consideration of age of patients.  We have first hand seen a patient asking for information, and put down in a rather demeaning manor in front of other patients in the waiting area.  This is not what I would expect to see being done to an elderly person.

The surgery is always running late.  We can understand a mid afternoon session running with delays due to the ripple effect, but when we have first appointments in the morning running with 40+ min delay, this is unacceptable.  Follow up are never followed up by the doctors unless you prompt them via phone call on the day.  If you are lucky you have a conversation with the doctor, or you are brushed away to try for an appointment the following day.

title: Great Dermatology dept
body: I attended the Dermatology Dept for a consultation about a "thing" on my face to my surprise they said they could remove it that day, I was quite worried that it was very close to my eye,I had also never had a local anaesthetic before, and the Covid risk, but I have to say the lady Doctor I saw was lovely she explained everything ,and then I saw the plastic surgeon who did my procedure,what a nice man ,he was funny and talked throughout about what he was doing,and made it a less daunting experience , great bedside manner. The nurses were all lovely . So a huge thank you to you all,

title: Impossible to contact
body:
I have been passed around like a bad penny from one doctor to another without any regards to my feelings on the matter, I was never asked, just passed off.
I have been messed about with incorrect sample bottles even though I asked for the correct ones. 
I don't feel valued or listened to, I feel like I'm just another number that brings in a few pounds when they bill the NHS. Don't bother trying to ring them as it's a waste of time and done of their people have limited people skills and do t know how to speak to people as people - having that said some of their receptionists are brilliant - just to be fair.

title: Good eService
body: I went online to see if I could change the dosage of a particular prescription medication. The questions and instructions were easy to follow and I received a phone call from the surgery remarkably quickly. In a couple of hours a doctor had been consulted, my request agreed and a prescription on it’s way to Boots! You can’t complain about a service as efficient as that! Thank you.

title: Great Practice
body: I phoned GP today reagarding my wife's chemo treatment  next week . The advice was helpfull amd suggested idea to ease treatment feat was fantastic and very thoughtfull/helpfull.

title: Can’t get an appointment
body: I need B12 jabs every 12 weeks but am now seriously overdue because I can’t get an appointment. I can never understand why it isn’t possible to book the next appointment when I have my jab but you are not allowed to book appointments more than 4 weeks ahead. When you ring either nobody answers or I have been cut off as soon as I start to speak. The online booking service still doesn’t work. I have been registered as extremely vulnerable due to recent breast cancer treatment so I don’t want to risk turning up 1st thing in the morning and standing in a queue but this looks like my only option. I am feeling very tired and weak due to my jab being overdue.

title: Great Doctors
body: Very nice doctor on the phone helpful and was able to deal with all my needs. She was able to get all my meds sorted out for me.

title: Very professional
body: Everything was well organised and my appointment was on time. The nurse was up to speed with what needed doing and I was pleased with the result.

title: Great treatment
body: I visited York hospital on the advice of my GP after suffering an injury to my foot. I cannot praise the professionalism, kindness and sympathy shown to me by all the staff too highly. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great attention to detail
body: I have been in far more regular contact with Maywood than usual owing to an infection sparked by possible COVID-19 (even though 8 have tested negative twice). All staff have been so professional and caring and I can’t thank them enough.

title: Very positive experience
body:
I received treatment at Cripps Health Centre for a sports injury in early 2019 whilst studying at Nottingham University.
I received a thorough assessment, treatment and relevant advice; all of which was explained well & delivered professionally. I’m very thankful for the support offered by my doctor throughout this period.
I’d recommend Cripps Health Centre to anyone either studying or living in the Nottingham area.

title: Prompt action, Great Practice
body:
I wish to express my sincere thanks to the lady GP who acted promptly today (5th June) to an email I sent regarding a Neurology referral. 
I was contacted shortly after sending the email by a very polite and pleasant receptionist. to say that she had passed my email to the GP and she would look into the matter.
I received a text message later on from the GP who had tried to expedite the referral  and referred me for a scan. The surgery acted very quickly in this stressful time due to the pandemic. Well Done to all concerned.

title: Cannot thank all the angels there enough
body: Every worker there was so lovely and kind and thoughtful I knew I wanted an abortion so was not struggling with feelings regarding that but I still appreciated the support those women gave me and it really helped ease any subconscious anxieties i might have had. forever grateful for the care i received here and i wish everyone who works there the best from life what you all do is so so important xxx

title: Excellent support and kindness
body:
We’ve had excellent and caring support from this team for the last year. The people who answer the phone are always helpful and pass messages on and offer to help further if necessary. Our regular CPN has been professional and diligent and we have always felt supported. I’ve read some pf the other reviews here and am really surprised ...we have had only positive experiences from any of the team we have had contact with. 
Thank you for everything you do especially during this difficult time. We appreciate you.

title: Great practice
body: Very happy with the service received during lockdown.  From the initial on line form, to a call back, a video call, prescription sent. Also a consultant follow up from another matter was chased and arranged for me. Well done

title: MRI Dept and Reception
body: I was called in to have an MRI, it being 5 years since Major brain surgery that saved my life. I was worried about coming in as it was the first time that I had left my local area since Lock-down began. I was immediately reassured by the gentle and pleasant greeting I received at the entrance door. I was offered hand gel and a mask to wear and directed to the MRI area. The receptionists sent me straight through and I was seen straight away. The waiting room had been rearranged to allow for social distancing and all staff wore masks so, again, I was reassured. As always, the Radiographers were kind, efficient and reassuring and I saw all equipment being sterilised as I was leaving. I write this to reassure others about coming to the hospital as I certainly felt that I was protected and looked after. Thank you to all the staff who continue to be amazing when they must be under such horrific strain. Thank you and stay safe!

readBy.name: The Walton Centre NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing pathology department!
body:
As a current NHS worker during these horrible covid times, I arrived slightly late to get my bloods done on a Friday evening.
The brilliant staff (2 ladies-one with blonde hair the other dark red/brown) in pathology were super kind and stayed a little later for me to get my bloods done. 
I use this service regularly and they are always so polite, kind, friendly, helpful and compassionate!
Thank you ladies for a great experience.. your a credit to our NHS!

title: Great practice
body: I moved to this surgery a couple of yours ago and it’s the best thing I have done.  The service  I have received is great even through these difficult times. Well done too you all

title: Excellent care
body: I have been with the practice for many years and I have always found the doctors nurses and staff to be very professional and caring. I am very grateful for all the care provided by the doctors throughout my husband’s illness, and for their continuing support. Thank you

title: Great Advice and Practice
body:
Really learnt a lot of things affecting my pain. Learnt about Pain, Pacing, Medications, Mindfulness., Posture and Movement,  
Communication,  Flare ups and Nutrition.

title: Grateful for such incredible care
body: I'd like to say thank you to Putneymead Medical Practice for the wonderful care I've received over the last 2 months. I have been someone that has needed support in managing my health post COVID-19. My GP has regularly checked in on me and has listened to me and offered advice & treatment options. She has kept me up to date with current research & has supported me with managing all aspects of post COVID-19 life - lifestyle, work, physical symptoms, mental health. I'm very grateful for such a caring GP and for receiving such a personal service in a time when services are stretched and medical staff are working so hard to manage this pandemic. I'm really thankful for my local practice & for the support, the care and for the kindness. My GP is wonderful and I'd highly recommend this practice to anyone that is moving to the local area.

title: Clean and brilliantly organised
body: I was extremely worried about visiting the hospital to get an MRI but when I got there it was very clean and amazingly organised.  Well done to all the staff for making it work and safe during such difficult times.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor treatment by receptionists
body: I had to pick up a prescription for a resident at the carehome I work at. We were told the prescription was behind the desk, yet the surgery receptionists told me to get out and go to the pharmacy, it wasn’t there either. After calling the GP again, he confirmed it was behind the desk and the receptionists had it the whole time, it wasn’t until I told them it was behind the desk that they went and looked for it for me. Staff were very rude and didn’t even try looking for the prescription as I could see them through the window sat chatting. This was medication needed urgently and I was made to feel in the wrong and very small because their treatment and attitude towards a care worker

title: So caring
body:
On the 1st June was admitted to A/E
With a very swollen left leg,after going through the rigmerhole of temp/blood pressure was transferred to other part (as prob high etc =covid 19) anyway waited about 40 mins in wheelchair then taken by a young lady possible junior doctor and was taken to cubical (bay majors 5)
She did a examination,then took blood loads, chest x-ray,all the way though she was chatting about different things,she told me there was a real chance of DVT clot of blood but said would would have long wait for results,she kept s check on me about 2hrs later a gentleman popped in to look at it a consultant and chatting outside with this young lady must have agreed.tocut the story short went home,came back for ultrasound scan next day confirmed 2 shades = DVT,
The main thing is I was stubon thought it would go away but forced to go to A/E by a nurse at boots walk-in centre,but the doctor in A/E was lovely,meaning all the hard work and long hours they are doing she was kind talking about life in general kept me informed and made me feel at ease,a credit to her and the hospital, doctors and nurses and porters well done take care stay safe

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Picking who to be friendly too
body: I was very sick and vomiting everywhere couldn’t speak Or move so my boyfriend called the ambulance but when they came one of the women was very mean she started shouting at me straight away like she was the police and I did something wrong very mean She didn’t want to talk to my boyfriend but me even though I couldn’t speak because it made me feel worse the only time she started being nice is when she realised I can speak English and the same thing happened in hospital so because someone can’t speak English does that mean you have to be very rude to them screaming at them when you can clearly see they are not doing well the nurse at the hospital was mean too till she was told I can speak English

title: Helpful and modern
body: This GP practice is very helpful. Appointments are arranged quickly, the GPs are responsive and caring. I highly recommend. Especially during the COVID-19 period they have been accessible and helpful.

title: Well equipped hospital
body: The hospital has all relevant facilities, expected of the major medical facility. But the long queues, even with booked appointments, the staff, that seems to be poorly motivated, doesn't make it a pleasant experience. As far as the medical experience is concerned?  It is important to be seen by the Senior Consultant, to detrive at required results, without number of repeat visits and run around in circles.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Excellent service
body: This has been our surgery for many years and it has proved invaluable, efficient and friendly. The doctors are approachable and excellent diagnosticians. Thank you.

title: The best receptionists I've ever spoken to
body: Since joining this practice, the receptionists have been polite, courteous and helpful in way that I have never experienced at other GPs. I have to have regular blood tests, and they have been so thoughtful in accommodating my needs and finding appointments that suit my work day. Whether in person or on the phone, they seem to sincerely care about my condition and making sure that I'm seen by the right people.
